page.title: 07River Ter
page.content: The River Ter winds itself from the top of our D Block to the bottom.The river twists through the fields of barley and wheat.If you walk along the river Ter in June or July you will find an abundance of wildlife.Some of the common birds you may see are wrens,blue tits, thrushes, sparrows, blackbirds, swallows and swifts. Insects which can be spotted by the river include cabbage white butterflies, tortise shell and Essex skipper butterflies.Also the bright blue colours of the Banded Agrion damoiselle flies can be seen flittering from bullrush to bullrush. The observant walker may spot a pair of watervoles skuttling along the river and the holes can be seen along the river bank. More unusual bird may be seen along the River Ter. If you are really lucky you will see flocks
